Both sets of the main characters set her back around $125 dollars, but what choice did she have? She was lucky that she could even access the page, what with the legions of Mascara fans that also desired these action figures, and second shipments are almost unheard of. Sighing, the black-haired girl opened up a new tab and went to her bank's website. Going through all the 'log in' screens and saw that her present balance was approximately $4.32. Faster than a second, her head met the cold wooden surface of her desk, the urge to bang her head against the material to be exponentially increasing. Truly at times, being an anime fan included much grief.

'Where in the world am I supposed to get enough money for next month.' Of course next month was going to be the release of the limited edition box set of Mascara season 1, which she greatly looked forward too. Usually a teenager like Kuroneko received a weekly allowance, however things had been tight monetary wise in the Gouki household. With the economy in its lowest point in years, her parents had to budget appropriately and Kuroneko understood why she needed to pitch in as well. The way that Kuroneko had amassed money in order to supply her egregious habit, was that she took part in photo-shoots that they often held in anime conventions. The girl had also won a few cosplay contests as well, but the convention season was pretty much over. It was nearing the middle of October and most conventions are held in the spring and summer where the weather is much more splendid and fair for the fans. In an attempt to quell her mind on this matter, Kuroneko decided to browse 2ch, a famous image board that hosts a variety of pages and specific boards for one to waste incredible amounts of time with. Ruri found herself surfing onto the Akihabara board, a sub-site where users would post all about the famous electric town. Most of the time, stores would promote themselves, obviously in touch with their technology-based fanbase. Going down the posts, a certain thread caught the interest of her cat's eye.

'Hm a nekomimi cafe? What in the world is that?' thought the girl, looking at the picture of a small cafe with a stylized cat-girl on the banner of the store. She clicked on the reply button in order to see the entirety of the original post. From the description the original poster stated that the cafe was looking for some new employment and boasted a pay of around 10 dollars an hour with any tips one would receive. From this statement alone, Kuroneko's curiosity grew. That pay was incredible, a job like that meant that the girl would never have to worry about her purchases and would even be able to give some of the money to help her parents out too. Reading over the rest of the post. it stated that the uniform would be a maid uniform complete with 'neko ears and a tail' and that they were looking for girls that were seventeen or older. Luckily, the 'dark' girl had just turned seventeen last month. The rest of the requirements were easy to accomplish and the girl wrote down both the phone number and the address of the eatery. Reading over the post once again, something at the very end of the list interested her. It read: 'girls should have a healthy appetite.'

"Huh, healthy appetite?" she wondered out loud. While she did posses a small frame, the girl could eat a lot if she was hungry enough or if she put her mind to it. Clicking off of the tab that contained the page, Kuroneko opted to download a few anime titles considering that she had some spare time. Typing away, it startled her when her purple flip-phone rang, a familiar tune reverberating throughout her room. Quickly grabbing the small device and read the caller ID. Quite quickly her face lit lid up with a rouge color.

"H-Hello."

"Hey Kuroneko! I was wondering if you'd be free tomorrow." The voice on the other side of the digital meridian was none other that Kyousuke Kosaka, brother of the siscon Krinio Kosaka and her secret crush of a few months. Usually the two would go on these little 'trips' with one another but Kuroneko never found the courage to advance on her feelings. Though she would decide to amp up her 'persona' as she heard that playing hard to get was a very good tactic.

While they were intended for children, Kuroneko loved to snack on these. She had completely forgotten that her mother had bought these a few days ago! One package of the snack consisted of six cookies, Kuroneko decided to grab three packs in order to avoid repeat trips. These were the one foodstuffs that she could not get enough of. 'Wow, 1:30 already. Maybe I should start sleeping earlier..." Indeed, this black-haired girl would often spend her nights browsing imageboards and watching anime. All of the female characters of the show were seen eating rather unhealthily. A few scene changes later, there was visible weight gain on the main female cast.

'Hm, this certainly is an interesting development.' thought the girl, munching on her cookies every now and then. Ruri keeps her eyes on the screen, watching the females getting larger and larger. A red hue was growing on her face and she felt a certain something in her stomach. She could not explain this sensation, but it was clouding up her mind. Kuroneko's stomach gnawed at her as she fixed dinner for her little sisters. The enticing smells of the food as they grilled and boiled on the stove tempting her; however she remained resolute and refused to partake of their food.

It had been several months since the Gokou family had moved from their house into a small apartment in another city. Her father had gotten a new, better paying job, and living in an apartment had reduced their expenses, so things were looking up for them; however they had yet to remove the shackles of living on a strict budget. Both of their parents still had to work, leaving Kuroneko/Ruri the sole caretaker of her little sisters, and with their appetites perking up lately it was only made harder.

Hinata, the middle sister, had gotten rather greedy lately, but Ruri knew it was the result of both a growth spurt and becoming a member of the school track team, bot of which demanded an increase in fuel for her young and growing body. Tamaki, the youngest and being the innocent, impressionable child she was, was simply imitating her older sibling, increasing her food intake in an attempt to assimilate Hinata's new eating habits.

With the financial strain of the moving expenses, new school expenses, and numerous other money sinks, their current budget for food was incredibly tight. To save her family the financial strain and still provide enough food for her little sisters, she decided to opt herself out of the food supply, eating only at breakfast, having a light snack before bed, and eating at whatever meals her parents happened to be present for. After two weeks of this though her stomach had become extremely irritable, growling and rumbling constantly throughout the day, even just after eating breakfast. It made things awkward in school when they would be listing to a lecture of doing a quiz and the silence would be broken by noises emanating from Ruri's irritable gut.

"Dinner's ready!", she called.

Instantly the smaller girls stampeded into the bathroom to wash up and Ruri barely had time to place the food on the table before they arrived and shouted "Itadakimas" and dug in.

"Don't eat to fast", she chided her young charges.

Hinata grinned sheepishly while Tamaki simply obeyed.

Ruri sighed and simply returned to the kitchen to start cleaning up the mess from cooking, and by the time she finished those the dishes from dinner would be finished.

Another irritable growl from her stomach reminded her of her pressing issue. For two weeks she had been at this, and it was starting to create negative effects on her. Her stamina was so low that she could barely get through PE during school, and traveling to Akihabara and searching for a rare figurine had almost been to much for her. She couldn't keep this up much longer. If she did, she would worry her parents and her attempted contribution to helping her family would fall flat, forcing her to postpone her allowance as an alternative, something she needed for her hobby.

There was a gentle tug at her apron and she looked down to see Tamaki standing there holding up her dishes.

"I cleaned my plate", she stated proudly.

Ruri smiled and accepted the dishes before patting her on the head. "You're a good girl for bringing your dishes too."

Tamaki was an exceptionally well behaved child, impressionable and naive yes, but well behaved and well meaning. Tamaki always brought her dishes to the sink when she was finished, something the older Hinata rarely did, so Ruri was always sure to praise the younger girl for it.

"Aren't you going to eat Nee-san?" Tamaki asked her.

Ruri turned her face away and replied: "No, i'm fine Tamaki."

The little girl frowned. "But I never see you eat."

"I eat with everyone at breakfast."

"But that's it", Tamaki protested. "Aren't you hungry Nee-san?"

Ruri smiled at her concern and kneeled to down to pet her on the head.

"I'm your big sister" Ruri told her, "and my job is to make sure you and Hinata have as much to eat as you need."

Tamaki pouted. "But that's not fair."

Ruri sighed, but held her smile. "It's all part of being a big sister. It's about being responsible and setting an example for you two."

Tamaki looked sad. "Being a big sister is hard."

Ruri let out a little laugh and pulled her baby sister into a hug. "Yes it is, but it's worth it when you have a good girl like you."

Ruri was happy when the praise managed to elicit a giggle from Tamaki.

"Can you promise me something then Nee-san?"

"What's that?"

"Promise me that when things are better you'll eat lots, and lots, and lots, and lots."

Ruri laughed again, but she understood what Tamaki was trying to say, and as if to agree, her stomach had remained obediently silent during this warm sibling exchange.

"I promise Tamaki." The two girls hooked their pinkies together, sealing the deal and Tamaki ran off to play, leaving Ruri alone again with the dishes, but no longer in the dour mood she had been.

Tamaki somehow always managed to make her feel better.

With Tamaki gone however, her stomach resumed its complaining.

'You on the other hand-'

Ruri knew now that she had no choice. If she was going to avoid serious problems in the near future she would have to take care of her stomach soon.

Ruri groaned as she walked home from school, her book bag felt as though it was full of lead, and during PE she nearly fainted from her lack of energy. She stopped and leaned against a fence, clutching her midsection with a free hand. It felt like her stomach was trying to eat out her insides, and it was painful. She had no idea that starving oneself could be so excruciating. With some reluctance she acknowledged that she had no choice but to dip into her personal funds to fill her imploding gut.

"I need a place where my money can go the farthest" she grunted as she started walking again. A buffet seemed like the logical choice but Japanese food buffets were fairly expensive and she needed her money to go as far as possible. Ruri had heard of a western style buffet from her classmates which had opened nearby a few weeks ago and western food was sometimes cheaper-if lower quality, and it was the closest place as far as she knew so she summoned the last of her strength and started in the direction to find it. Her stomach even stopped hurting as if to encourage her, but also saying 'you'd better feed me'.

The buffet wasn't hard to find, it was among a group of small office buildings and a large sign saying "All you can eat western grub" indicated where she needed to go.

"What a tasteless title" she muttered. Her hunger didn't give her the option to be picky however and the hourly charge seemed reasonable enough so she gritted her teeth and went inside.

The interior was as tacky as the title. The inside was full of 'cowboy' type paraphernalia, like wagon wheels, wooden barrels, ropes, and even cattle skulls.

"This just gets worse and worse" she muttered but her stomach was starting to act up again so she pressed forward to the cashier.

"Howdy, welcome to Western Grub" she greeted cheerfully.

'They even try to greet you in English.' "One hour of all you can eat please."

"Sure little miss" The cashier took her money and printed our her receipt. "Pick a table, grab some grub and chow down!" She said as Ruri walked off.

'How corny can you get?' Ruri thought as she found her self a secluded spot in the corner to set down her bag and then went to the buffet line.

It was currently the twilight between lunch and dinner rushes so there weren't very many people. She grabbed a plate, which was quite large, and looked at the spread of food before her. She recognized some like mashed potatoes, beans and steak but there was so much else.

"This your first time?"

Ruri turned her head and saw another girl wearing a yellow one piece dress uniform in contrast to Ruri's dark blue sailor fuku. This girl was a from another school, a fancy one judging by the uniform. Her hair was a medium brown and her eyes a bright green. She was also fairly tall, not as much as Saori but at least 165cm.

"Y-yes." Ruri answered simply. "Much of the food looks strange to me."

The other girl giggled. "Yes, it does look different from what most Japanese people eat. Here let me help you out." The girl dumped a large mound of mashed potatoes onto Ruri's plate and then started heaping ham, sausages and something she didn't recognize. She then went over to a dispenser and drowned the mashed potatoes in gravy before handing Ruri back her plate.

"C'mon, let's eat together."

As much as Ruri wanted to eat alone she doubted the girl would take 'no' for an answer and besides that she didn't want to be rude after she had helped her, although Ruri had never carried such a heavy plate meant for one person before. She lead the girl to her table and the two sat down.

"I'm Yuuki by the way" the girl said. "It's nice to meet you."

"Ruri Gokou."

"Ruri? That's a cute name."

Ruri grimaced slightly. Yes she had a cute name and it bothered her a bit sometimes, hence one of the reasons she preferred to go by 'Kuroneko', but if she was honest she didn't hate the name.

"Now let's dig in before it gets cold" Yuuki said as she started cutting up her steak.

Ruri sighed and picked up her fork. She took a bit out of the gravy soaked mashed potatoes and put it in her mouth. She moaned softly as the taste hit her tongue, the gravy, which she'd never tasted before, seemed to enhance the taste of everything it touched and as she savored the taste her stomach seemed to shout 'GIMMIE GIMMIE GIMIIE!' She swallowed and her whole body seemed to relax a bit, finally with something to sustain it and knowing more was on the way.

"It's good isn't it?" Yuuki grinned, watching the smaller girl's reactions.

Ruri blushed slightly. "Y-yes. The food here is surprisingly despite the tacky decor and lazy presentation."

Yuuki laughed. "Don't you think if it was presented fancy like other places it wouldn't match the atmosphere?"

"I suppose that's true" Ruri said right before she shoveled more gravy lathered mashed potatoes into her mouth. "I suppose here the theme is quantity, not quality."

"It's a buffet, that's how it should be" Yuuki grinned. "Now speaking of quantity, let's dig in and get this quantity in our bellies!"

Ruri needed little encouragement. The food was delicious and she was starving so she began shoveling the food in as fast as she could swallow it. She finished off the potatoes and then gobbled up the ham and sausages with a speed and gusto that surprised herself. It took barely ten minutes for Ruri to clean her plate and the girl leaned back and put a hand on her stomach, now happy to have some real food in her.

"I hope you're not full yet" Yuuki said as she finished. "You paid for an hour right? It's only been about fifteen minutes since you got here probably so let's make the most of our money and take up the whole hour!"

"Eat more?" Ruri wasn't sure. True she had only been here for a small fraction of the time she paid for but she'd already eaten a fair amount and though her stomach still yearned for more 'grub' she wasn't eager to make a pig of herself either.

1552.content:
Shizuoka, Japan. Surga Ward.

Home to Shizuoka University, right in spitting distance to the sea. And spitting distance away is where we find our actors on this stage.

Standing on the pavement looking up at the condo, situated next door to a maid cafe, a hawaiian based one at that, was one male and five females.

Kyosuke Kousaka, age 21. Weighing at 61.2 kilograms(135 pounds) and standing at 180 centimeters(5 foot 9 inches). He stood hands on hips with a proud grin. He was currently a student and a junior at Shizuoka University with the intent on becoming a psychologist.

To his left, Kirino Kousaka, age 18. Weighing at 48 kilograms(105.8 pounds) and standing at 169 centimeters(5 foot 5 inches), with her three sizes being 85/55/86. Over the past years, her figure has blossomed a tiny bit, but still remained the small chested genki-girl. She looked up at the condo with an unamused glance. She then turned towards the rest of the group, eyebrow twitching.

Ruri “Kuroneko” Goko, age 19. She failed on her first entrance exam but passed on the second. Weighing in at 46 kilograms(101 pounds) and standing 164 centimeters(5 foot 4 inches), with her three sizes being 80/55/80. The girl still preferred dressing in a black lolita dress, even in the August heat in coastal Japan, and she remained petite as ever.

"Can't believe they all came along..." Kirino rolled her eyes as she muttered under her breath. Granted, over the last several years, she and Ruri have bonded into something of Frienemies, friends one minute and rivals the next. When she passed and decided to go to the same university as her brother she was overjoyed...

Until finding out that Ruri found out that Kyosuke went to Shizuoka, and applied there. She failed on her first exam try out the year before, but now she passed and in the same freshman class as the former track star.

“So you’re inviting us all to stay with you Kyosuke-shi! You’re too kind!” Chirped a giant of a girl. Saori Makishima, or Saori Bajeena as she is called, stood at 183 centimeters(6 feet) and weighed in at 64 kilograms(143 pounds) and her three sizes were 91/61/92, with a next perky full bosom under her green checkered long sleeve. She still towered over the group and supported a nice full D-cup bosom. What was unique in Saori’s case was that she couldn’t take the entrance exam when she was 18 due to going on a globe wide trip with the family as a result of winning a lottery, only increasing their finances even more. The mecha otaku promised to the Kousaka family she would help pay for the Condo and cover Ruri’s expenses, earning the goth otaku’s gratitude.

“Don’t mention it.” Smiled Kyosuke bashfully. “You are covering for half of the place after all. Felt good getting out of that dorm. Plus, it’s so close to campus we can talk and don’t use the car that often.”

“Great idea!” Said a melodic voice which made Kirino roll her eyes again. It didn’t help that Kuroneko was here.

But Manami too!

The plain and pleasant Manami Tamura was already a student at the university, and she has grown up since Kirino last saw her, and to think that she had three years to herself for Kyosuke…unforgiveable!

Manami stood next to Saori smiling like always, standing at 173 centimeters(5 feet 6 inches) and weighing at 55 kilograms(121.25 pounds) and her three sizes at 89/62/90, another of the group having a decent bust size of a C-cup. As much Kirino hated to admit, despite her B cup, three others had her beat.

Thankfully her good friend next to Manami wasn’t eager to show it off, like with Manami’s cut open blouse and Saori’s buttoned down, revealing cleavage.

Her dear friend Ayase Aragaki took the same exam test as her, as well as applied to the same university, and it made the blonde feel comfortable. The dark haired girl, standing smiling as she observed her surroundings, stood at 170 centimeters (5 foot 5 inches), weighed at 48 kilograms(105.8 pounds) and her three sizes being 83/59/86. She was third in the power rankings of bust size, with C-cup.

To think…

They all agreed to move into a new condo…close to Uni…under one roof for University as Kyosuke plans to take his Graduates courses next year.

Thus begins a new life…

15521.content:
"Okay then..." Kirini marched forward and stood in front of the group, arms crossed and face scowling. "First things first, we need to assign rooms! After all, we may have to share and-"

"It's okay Kirino-shi," smiled Saori, adjusting her glasses. "The condo has enough rooms for all of us!"

"Eh?" Kirino blinked. She then pointed a finger at each person and did a tally count. One, two, three, four, five, and herself making six.

"You're saying we have six rooms total?" She asked incredulously. "I mean, don't condo's usually have three rooms?"

"We bought neighboring unites. They all connect in the garage." Said Kyosuke. "Three rooms in each one. One kitchen, two bathrooms, one living room."

Kirino blinked, surprised. "Wow. You actually thought this through." She crossed her arms. "Guess your smart for something after all."

"Whose getting his graduates program again?" Snarked back the sole male.

"I'm sure Kirino will get a graduates!" Ayase spoke up, defending her long good friend. "She just needs time first, you just have a head start!"

"Oui oui easy now everyone," Saori said, calming things down. "For now, let's see who is sleeping where okay?"

"A good plan of action indeed," said Kuroneko in a calm and cold voice. "It is best for us to think of our living arrangements, rather than bicker and quarrel," she took a look at Kirino. "About nothing."

"Nothing! You just said the exact thing I said, only in a quieter voice Pretentious Princess!"

Ruri rolled her eyes. But the both of them looked back at Kyosuke...then back at each other. And sparks raged between their gaze.

The college student sighed, rubbing the back of his head. 'Their gonna fight over who sleeps in the same complex as me.'

"Let's head inside our new home to see the house's inside and see who sleeps where okay~?" Winked Saori holding the floorplan and walking ahead.

"sure thing!" Nodded Manami, following after the Gundam otaku with grace. Both Ruri and Kirino saw the meganeko walk past, and a thought came through.

'She will try to get a room close to Kyosuke too!' Both of them thought at the same time. 'I won't lose to her!'

Meanwhile, Ayase was thinking of having the same complex with Kirino, imagining the bathing together and...

As everyone followed Manami and Saori inside, there was a rumbling of a stomach...

155211.content:
A low and long growl came from one of the pair, causing a silence to fall in front of their new living quarters. Kirino and Ruri pointed fingers at each other, accusing the other of such unladylike behavior. They soon began to bicker, their tempers rising to a boiling point. Kyousuke rushed up to them, placing a firm hand on each of their shoulders.

"Hey, both of you calm down right now. We're all hungry after a long day of getting here and lugging all of our luggage around. Let's just get settled and then we can figure out our food situation, alright?" said the young man, doing his best to give a stern look towards his little sister and friend. Both girls pouted as they took their belongings and entered the condo. Everyone else followed, Ayase sticking to Kyosuke as he lifted the brunt of their things.

"Wow, Kyousuke, you've gotten pretty good at handling those two. I really admire that." said the girl with long blue hair, a sincere smile on her normally adorable face.

"Eh, its nothing, Its just how those to are after all. Do you need help with your bags?"

"Oh, no its fine! You're already carrying so much." Quickly walking towards the door, the girl drop her luggage inside and held open the door for the young man. Dropping off his things as well, he took a good look of his surroundings. The front door opened to a decent sized living room, with three white couches, some coffee tables and some decorative art. In front was the staircase to the second floor and to the right was the door to the garage, which lead to the other side of the condo.

"Wow, this place is pretty impressive. Glad we can afford it." Everyone had gathered in the living room, awaiting the other two to see how they would arrange their living spaces.

"Alright, now that everyone's here, let's discuss how we're going to split up the rooms."

"I want to be with Kirino!" shouted Ayase, raising her arm up high.

"I want to be with Kyousuke!" shouted Kirino and Manami at the same time, the orange haired young woman glaring at the one with glasses. Kyousuke gave out a nervous laugh. This was going to be troublesome indeed.
155211.title: The start of something new

1552111.content:
After much bickering and shouts, Saori eventually came to a calm and rational decision. The only way to solve this housing issue was to draw straw, short ones would get the right side of the house and long one would get the left side of the house. Five tense minutes later and the drawings were done. Kyousuke, Ruri and Kirino would take the left side of the house, while Ayase, Manami and Saori would take the left.

"Oh Kirino, we didn't get to room in the same house!" shouted a hysterical Ayase, throwing her arms over Kirino's shoulders and started to whine. Kirino was silently happy that she could spend even more time with her brother but was still worried about Kuroneko. She was always a clever one and most likely had many plans up her small sleeves. Ruri held an air of victory but her face was as inexpressive as usual. Kyousuke himself was fine with the outcome, just as long as no one would fight over it. Looking over to his small black haired friend, he gave her a smirk, causing her face to glow a soft shade of red. She was always quite easy to tease.

"So then, now that we got that settled, let's go put away our things real quick so we can go get a bite to eat. It's been a long day after all." said the tall Saori, once again taking a leadership role for the group. Manami was a bit disappointed in the outcome of things, but she would not let it deter her from her long time goal. Taking his own bags, Kyousuke decided to take the only room on the first floor, since he figured that it was the best way to give the girls some privacy. He left a whining Ayase with Kirino attempting to console her and went to the room. The room itself was of a decent size, with a medium sized bed, a wardrobe, a desk and even a brand new tv. Saori made sure that their living spaces would be fully furnished and come with a few extra perks as well. Setting down his bags and luggage, he sat on top of his bed, simply taking in the air.

"So, this is going to be my room for the next four years huh?"

"No, this is going to be our home." said Kuroneko, walking in through the door way, with a soft smile.

"Yeah, you're right."
